summary: Small, atmospheric and lore-friendly player home for the modest adventurer, located just north of Whiterun. Great view, some crafting and storage.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#1e84cc][size=4][b]Description:[/b][/size][/color]

Whiterun Watch is a small, lore friendly player home. Located on a windy hilltop just north of Whiterun, the shack offers -as the name so subtly hints at; a great view towards Whiterun/Dragonsreach, and the surrounding plains.

Since the player home is rather small and located in a rural area it is best suited for up and coming Dragonborns who like to live in the wilderness and travel alone without wife, kids and 3 followers. Despite that, and the fact that there's only one single bed in the shack, the home is navmeshed, so followers will follow inside, horses will wait outside.

It is intended as a more modest, down-to-earth player home, but I've tried to make it a good combo of atmosphere and functionality, and fitted in some practical features. If you want more features than what's mentioned below, you'll either need to travel to the nearest town...or find another player home.

[color=#1e84cc][size=4][b]Features:[/b][/size][/color]

Cooking Pot
Bookshelves (30 books)
Enchanting Table
Alchemy Table
Workbench
Weapon Racks (4 weapons)

Tanning Rack (outside)
Chopping Block (outside)

This mod also features a Super Deluxe Bonus for Dragonborn only: a unique fast travel point!
All inside furniture and storage chests, barrels and sacks are no-respawning. The barrels outside are respawning.

[color=#1e84cc][size=4]How to aquire it:[/size][/color]
The home is located north of Whiterun, west of Loreius Farm, between Halted Stream Camp and Korvanjund. Find your way there, and look for a journal. If you can solve it's mind bending puzzle, you'll find the key, and all the glory of this player home will be yours to keep.


[color=#1e84cc][size=4][b]Requirements:[/b][/size][/color]

Skyrim.esm
No DLC is required.

[color=#1e84cc][size=4]Compability:[/size][/color]

This mod edits exterior cells Tamriel 3,6 and 5,6, and will conflict with other mods who do the same.
Cell 3,6 is the one with the player home, so if the other cell is overwritten after you've acquired the key, it might theoretically go well, I haven't tested that.


[color=#1e84cc][size=4][b]Other Technical info:[/b][/size][/color]

The mod is navmeshed and cleaned withTESVEdit.
The mod uses vanilla assets only, so just drag and drop the .esp-file to your data folder.
The mod has been moderately tested by myself.
author: Chiaro22
